programme.title: Khatta Meetha
programme.desc: Khatta Meetha, directed by Priyadarshan and starring Akshay Kumar and Trisha Krishnan, is a satirical comedy that highlights the absurdities of the Indian bureaucratic system. The film centers around a small-time road contractor who faces numerous hurdles, including red tape, corrupt officials, and family feuds, while trying to complete a government project. Blending humor with social commentary, the movie offers a bittersweet take on systemic flaws and personal perseverance.

programme.title: Mission Majnu
programme.desc: Set against the backdrop of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, the film follows Amandeep Singh, a RAW agent operating undercover in Pakistan. As he uncovers Pakistan's nuclear ambitions, he must navigate personal and professional challenges to complete his mission.

programme.title: Khatta Meetha
programme.desc: Khatta Meetha, directed by Priyadarshan and starring Akshay Kumar and Trisha Krishnan, is a satirical comedy that highlights the absurdities of the Indian bureaucratic system. The film centers around a small-time road contractor who faces numerous hurdles, including red tape, corrupt officials, and family feuds, while trying to complete a government project. Blending humor with social commentary, the movie offers a bittersweet take on systemic flaws and personal perseverance.

programme.title: Mission Majnu
programme.desc: Set against the backdrop of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, the film follows Amandeep Singh, a RAW agent operating undercover in Pakistan. As he uncovers Pakistan's nuclear ambitions, he must navigate personal and professional challenges to complete his mission.

programme.title: NH 10
programme.desc: NH10 is an intense survival thriller starring Anushka Sharma as Meera, a woman who embarks on a road trip with her husband, only to witness an honor killing. When they intervene, they find themselves hunted by the perpetrators in a lawless rural region. The film explores themes of gender violence, societal injustice, and the terrifying vulnerability of urban citizens in rural anarchy. Directed by Navdeep Singh, NH10 delivers gripping tension, gritty realism, and a powerful female lead performance.

programme.title: Khatta Meetha
programme.desc: Khatta Meetha, directed by Priyadarshan and starring Akshay Kumar and Trisha Krishnan, is a satirical comedy that highlights the absurdities of the Indian bureaucratic system. The film centers around a small-time road contractor who faces numerous hurdles, including red tape, corrupt officials, and family feuds, while trying to complete a government project. Blending humor with social commentary, the movie offers a bittersweet take on systemic flaws and personal perseverance.

programme.title: Double Dhamaal
programme.desc: Directed by Indra Kumar, this follow-up to Dhamaal reunites the original gang Ritesh Deshmukh, Arshad Warsi, Aashish Chaudhary, and Javed Jaffrey as they attempt to double-cross a slick businessman (Sanjay Dutt). With new additions Kangana Ranaut and Mallika Sherawat, the film delivers over-the-top antics and comedic twists.

programme.title: Parmanu - The Story of Pokhran
programme.desc: Based on true events, Parmanu – The Story of Pokhran follows the journey of a dedicated IAS officer, Ashwat Raina, who leads a top-secret mission to conduct India’s first underground nuclear tests in 1998 at Pokhran, Rajasthan. Battling political opposition, espionage threats, and tight deadlines, the team works against all odds to place India on the world’s nuclear map. The film is a patriotic thriller about courage, strategy, and national honor.

programme.title: Aitraaz
programme.desc: Directed by Abbas Mustan, this romantic thriller stars Akshay Kumar, Priyanka Chopra, and Kareena Kapoor. The film tackles the sensitive issue of male sexual harassment, with Chopra delivering a standout performance that earned critical acclaim. Inspired by the 1994 film Disclosure, Aitraaz was both a commercial and critical success.
